question:
During a recent plane journey, you sat next to a businessman who owns a chain of restaurants. You talked to him and he suggested that you should contact him about a possible job in one of his restaurants.
Write a letter to this businessman. In your letter

remind him when and where you met
tell him what kind of job you are interested in
say why you think you would be suitable for the job
text: I am marvis davell. I happen to meet you during New York to Paris flight in Turkish airways on July 23, where you sat beside me and advised me if I would like to work with you in one of your restaurant. Now I am considering your great proposal to get better opportunities.

I am fortunate to meet you coincidentally I was on the vacation and trying to release the stress of work. I have accepted your offer and make you assure that I am graduated from New York University in management after that I persued further diploma regarding hotel and Management courses and done my M.Phil in administration sector. Having remarkable managerial skills and 10 years of experience while conducting numerous workshops and trained hundreds of people in the same fields.

Despite all this, I am happy with my current job but I am willing to face new more challenging things so that i can flourish my capabilities farther. I would kindly appreciate of your prompt action on behalf of  my accomplishments.
I look forward to hearing from you soon.

error_list.error_des: It appears that the word marvis may be a proper noun in this context. Consider capitalizing the word.
It appears that the word airways may be a proper noun in this context. Consider capitalizing the word.
The singular countable noun restaurant follows the quantifier one of, which requires a plural noun. Consider using a plural noun or a different quantifier.
The word persued doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The word persued doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The noun phrase administration sector seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The pronoun I should always be capitalized.
The word farther doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It appears that the word Your is not the correct form of the possessive pronoun. Consider changing it.
